question_text:
Evaluate the expression.
$0.1 \div 0.2 - 0.5$
Write your answer as an integer or a decimal. Do not round.
_
solution:
First, identify the operations in the expression.
$0.1 \div 0.2 - 0.5$

This expression has division and subtraction. The order of operations says to divide before subtracting.
$0.1 \div 0.2 - 0.5$
=0.5-0.5
The value of the expression is 0.

question_text:
Evaluate the expression.
$1 \times 0.5 - 0.3$
Write your answer as an integer or a decimal. Do not round.
_
solution:
First, identify the operations in the expression.
$1 \times 0.5 - 0.3$

This expression has multiplication and subtraction. The order of operations says to multiply before subtracting.
$1 \times 0.5 - 0.3$
=0.5-0.3
The value of the expression is 0.2.

question_text:
Evaluate the expression.
$1 + 5 \times 0.6$
Write your answer as an integer or a decimal. Do not round.
_
solution:
First, identify the operations in the expression.
$1 + 5 \times 0.6$

This expression has addition and multiplication. The order of operations says to multiply before adding.
$1 + 5 \times 0.6$
=1+3
The value of the expression is 4.

question_text:
Evaluate the expression.
$3 + 0.2 \div 0.1$
Write your answer as an integer or a decimal. Do not round.
_
solution:
First, identify the operations in the expression.
$3 + 0.2 \div 0.1$

This expression has addition and division. The order of operations says to divide before adding.
$3 + 0.2 \div 0.1$
=3+2
The value of the expression is 5.

question_text:

_
solution: Apply order of operations: parentheses first, then multiplication, then subtraction.

Multiply: 1.6 x 4.4 = 7.04
